body.header: Complete the plan on the right by choosing a suitable counter-argument (A-H) from the list on the left. There are more counter-arguments than arguments, so you will not use them all.

section.span: Greater profits for the agriculture industry
Tampering with nature is nothing new in agriculture
GM crops could be grown in difficult environments such as semi-desert
Farmers of GM crops are less dependent on environmentally harmful insecticides
GM crops last longer in storage
Improved nutritional value of GM food
Improved flavour and appearance of GM foods

div.p: GM foods may be bad for our health
GM crops may cause ecological damage (e.g. kill harmless insects)

section.p: In Unit 6 we saw how a balanced 'for and against' composition can be written by matching arguments and counter-arguments to form paragraphs. A similar outline can be used for a 'one-sided' composition. In this case, however, linking phrases are used to 'refute' each argument with a counter-argument.
